alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 5:43PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Clear Creek...including Chinook...Moderate flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Machinist Road not passable. Clear Creek Road covered by water in two locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 PM MDT Saturday was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 06/19/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/hydrograph.php?wfo=tfx&gage=ccmm8. The next statement will be issued as necessary or no later than Sunday morning at 600 AM MDT.
